item.title: How to Create a Shiny App
item.author: lakmoller@gmail.com (Lisa Moller)
item.description: If you’d like to follow along, install “shiny” and “shinyWidgets” install.packages(“shiny”) What Are You Going to Cover? WHY make a Shiny app? Basics of Shiny through making a simple app with two files Small bit on reactive programming While this will be a pretty basic post to get started with Shiny, I will provide resources at the end that I have found helpful. I have made several apps for work that are getting larger and larger.

item.title: Get Involved
item.author: lakmoller@gmail.com (Lisa Moller)
item.description: CONTRIBUTE and grow your skills - there is something for everyone, no matter what level you are at! Data for Democracy - Check for a Meetup in your area Code for America Brigade - Check for a Meetup in your area Viz for Social Good Data Kind Datanauts CLASSES are a great way to interact with the community and grow your skills. For free Kaggle Coursera

item.title: First Post - My Plan
item.author: lakmoller@gmail.com (Lisa Moller)
item.description: I am very excited to start recording some of my work, thought processes, passion and excitement for data science and social policy. I plan to share R and Python code from projects I’m working on, books I’m reading, classes I’m taking… partly to be selfish and relearn the information by “teaching” it, but also hoping to reach people interested in (and new to) the intersection of data science and the policy/non-profit world.

item.title: Amazing Tech/Social Policy Groups
item.author: lakmoller@gmail.com (Lisa Moller)
item.description: Team Upturn Legal Hackers Mechanism Design for Social Good University of Chicago Center for Data Science and Social Policy D.C. Policy Center Equal Future Center for Policing Equity Ethics & Algorithms Toolkit

item.title: Reading List
item.author: lakmoller@gmail.com (Lisa Moller)
item.description: This started more as a place to keep all of the book and article suggestions that I've receieved, or interesting titles I've come across - meaning I haven't read many of these books/articles/papers, but would love to. I am SURE there are plenty I am leaving off of here - please add favorites to the comments! I will also continue to find all of the emails I sent myself and notes in margins of randoms notebooks to find more titles…

item.title: Sites for Interesting Datasets
item.author: lakmoller@gmail.com (Lisa Moller)
lakmoller@gmail.com (Lisa Moller)
item.description: Front Page Content beautifulhugo supports content on your front page. Edit /content/_index.md to change what appears here. Delete /content/_index.md if you don't want any content here.

item.title: Background
item.author: lakmoller@gmail.com (Lisa Moller)
item.description: My love for data and policy started in undergrad as I was studying math and biology. As my research became more focused, I saw how people used/misused/ignored data and research when making policy decisions. I chose to go to law school wanting to use my technical background to help support research-based policy. After working several years as an attorney focused on Health Law and Policy, I turned my attention to programming.

item.title: Background
item.author: lakmoller@gmail.com (Lisa Moller)
item.description: My name is Inigo Montoya. I have the following qualities: I rock a great mustache I'm extremely loyal to my family What else do you need? my history To be honest, I'm having some trouble remembering right now, so why don't you just watch my movie and it will answer all your questions.
